title: Battery maker close to deal for Coventry gigafactory
notes:
Location:
The project is located in Coventry, West Midlands, UK.

Capacity:
The planned capacity of the lithium-ion battery production facility is up to 60GWh per annum, which is enough to power 600,000 electric vehicles.

Investment amounts:
The project has secured planning consent for a £2.5bn investment. Additionally, there are talks with leading Asian battery manufacturers for further investment.

Project progress:
The project has secured planning consent for the land at Coventry Airport. It is in advanced talks with leading Asian battery manufacturers and is aiming to secure an investor with the support of the UK Government.

Project type:
The project is a new build, as it involves the construction of a large-scale battery production facility from scratch.

Value chain stages:
The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: West Midlands Gigafactory, the largest in the UK, to secure the British automotive industry's long-term electric future – Coventry City Council
notes:
Location:
- The project is located at Coventry Airport in the West Midlands, UK.

Capacity:
- At full capacity, the Gigafactory will be capable of delivering up to 60GWh of production per year. However, it is expected to begin supplying high-tech batteries for electric vehicles from 2025.

Investment amounts:
- The project involves a £2.5bn investment, creating up to 6,000 new highly skilled jobs directly and thousands more in the wider supply chain in Coventry and the surrounding region.

Project progress:
- The project has submitted an outline planning proposal in July, and the application is yet to be determined. It is expected to begin supplying batteries for electric vehicles from 2025.

Project type:
- N/A

Value chain stages:
- The project aims to cover the entire value chain, including recycling used batteries and building new ones in an industry-leading approach known as "cradle to cradle."

Note: The project is a joint venture between Coventry City Council and Coventry Airport Ltd, supported by an alliance of local governments, industrial groups, and universities. It is strategically crucial for the UK’s electrified future, especially for the automotive industry which will stop producing petrol and diesel engines from 2030.

title: Coventry Gigafactory targets 60 GWh capacity
notes:
Location:
- The West Midlands Gigafactory project is located at Coventry Airport in the West Midlands, UK.

Capacity:
- The envisioned capacity of the battery production hub is 60 GWh, with production expected to start in 2025.

Investment amounts:
- The project is expected to result from a £2.5 billion investment (about three billion euros), but the funding has yet to be attracted. The UK government has promised up to £500 million (around €573 million) in stimulus funding for a Gigafactory in the UK.

Project progress:
- The planning application was submitted in July, and as of January 2022, the outline plans for the factory have been approved by the planning committees of Coventry City Council and Warwick District Council. The target remains for the factory to be ready for production in 2025.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the planning committees approving outline plans for the factory.

title: Britishvolt gets £100m boost to build UK’s first large-scale ‘gigafactory’
notes:
Location:
- The battery manufacturing project is located near Blyth in Northumberland, in the north-east of England.

Capacity:
- The plant aims to produce 30GWh of batteries annually, with the first batteries scheduled to start production in 2024. At full capacity, the plant is expected to employ about 3,000 workers.

Investment amounts:
- The UK government is set to invest £100m in Britishvolt through the Automotive Transformation Fund. Additionally, the full project is expected to cost £3.8bn, with backing from other investors such as Glencore.

Project progress:
- The project has received government backing and has begun preparatory construction work at the 93-hectare site. Britishvolt is also working on the timing of a planned stock market listing to raise the money to build the production line.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with preparatory construction work already underway at the site.

Value chain stages:
- The facility aims to cover the entire value chain stages, from cathode and anode manufacturing to cell fabrication and module assembly.
